Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an invasion of the right to free speech.
The ACMA's role in regulating information is perceived as biased and a conflict of interest.
The proposed powers are compared to a social credit system similar to China's.
Concerns about the legislation being part of a broader agenda involving Digital IDs and restricted movement.
Notable Quotes: These new proposed powers are an invasion of a democratic right to free speech.
This is merely legislative course to initiate a social credit score for Australia as the CCP has already done so in China.
